headline: Ford Seeks a ‘Model T’ Moment with New EV Platform. That’s Easier Said Than Done.
summary: Ford sees its next Model T moment with the new EV platform. That’s easier said than done, though, given competition and Ford’s persistent issues with quality and execution.

raw.headline: Ford Seeks a ‘Model T’ Moment with New EV Platform. That’s Easier Said Than Done.
raw.summary: Ford sees its next Model T moment with the new EV platform. That’s easier said than done, though, given competition and Ford’s persistent issues with quality and execution.

headline: Ford recalls 312K vehicles for loss of power brake assist
summary: The problem was escalated to the automaker’s Critical Concern Review Group on May 14 after the issue was identified on a management lease vehicle.

headline: Ford recalls more than 103k F-150 trucks over rear axle hub bolt defects
summary: NHTSA estimates that only about 1% of the vehicles are affected by this defect.

headline: GE Appliances to invest over $3 billion in US manufacturing push
summary: Global firms have been increasing their investments and presence in the United States after President Donald Trump pushed companies across sectors, including Apple and Ford, to produce goods within the country and generate jobs.  The GE Appliances investment will create 1,000 jobs in five states and is aimed at expanding the company's air conditioning and water heating portfolio, increasing production output and modernizing its 11 U.S. manufacturing plants with new automation and capital equipment, the home appliances maker said.  Earlier this year, peer Carrier Global also said it planned to invest $1 billion over five years in the U.S.

headline: Electric Light Commercial Vehicle Market worth $116.60 billion by 2032 | MarketsandMarkets
summary: The electric light commercial vehicle market is projected to reach USD 116.60 billion by 2032 from USD 24.49 billion in 2025 at a CAGR of 25.0% during 2025–2032, according to a new report by MarketsandMarkets. The growth in the electric light commercial vehicle (eLCV) market can be attributed to the rising demand for efficient urban delivery and service vehicles, driven by e-commerce expansion and small business needs. headline: Performance Brokerage Services Advises on the Sale of Covina Hills Chevrolet in Covina, California
summary: Performance Brokerage Services, North America's highest volume dealership brokerage firm, is pleased to announce the sale of Covina Hills Chevrolet in Covina, California from Jim Ross to Braeden Mueller.

headline: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From Ford’s Q2 Earnings Call
summary: Ford’s second quarter performance drew a positive market response, as the company exceeded Wall Street’s expectations for both revenue and non-GAAP profit. Management attributed these results to robust sales momentum in its Ford Pro commercial segment, strategic cost improvements, and increased demand for hybrid and electric vehicles. headline: F Q2 Deep Dive: Cost Controls and Product Strategy Offset Margin Pressures
summary: Automotive manufacturer Ford (NYSE:F) reported Q2 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5% year on year to $50.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.37 per share was 11.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
